Sentence.sentence: They indicate the future direction of media reform.
It is the direction energy development should follow.
just perceiving norms is enough to cause people to adjust their behaviour in the direction of the crowd.
Whether it's a sports team or a presidential campaign, everybody relishes having the big momentum, because it makes them harder to stop or change direction.
Oprah Winfrey's honorary doctorate was a step in the wrong direction.
Other funding agencies, public and private, are moving in a similar direction.
Crucially, as they opened up their markets, they balanced market economy with sensible government direction.
Respect is shown by looking in the general direction but avoiding direct eye contact.
Although many people say the new Barbies are a step in the right direction, some people say they don't go far enough.

Sentence.sentence: birds flock together, fish school together, cattle herd together...just perceiving norms is enough to cause people to adjust their behaviour in the direction of the crowd.

Sentence.sentence: Good leaders left the company, taking Nokia's sense of vision and direction with them.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: More than drones dropping a new supply of underwear on your doorstep, Apple's massively successful brick-and-mortar-and-glass retail stores and Amazon's small steps in the same direction are what should keep old-fashioned retailers awake at night.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: That means concentrating on the direction of your life in general and your own academic performance specifically.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: This mood switch made no difference to the three-month-olds; but for the nine-month-olds, it was enough to renew their interest and they started looking again in the direction of the face.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"命令"之意。
means: command ： 较正式用词，强调权威性、全局性和强制性。
order ： 普通用词，侧重指具体的命令。
direction ： 正式用词，指口头或书面的指示或命令。内容不一定详尽，语气较缓和，不太强调强制性。也可指指导性的说明。
instruction ： 书面用词，指不容违反、不容推翻的命令。也多指包含具体说明的指示。

stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+direct直接的→adj.间接的, 迂回的
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
direct直接的+ly表副词→adv.直接地, 立即
correct[v.改正,纠正]+itude状态→纠正后的状态
correct[v.改正,纠正]+ive表名词→n.矫正物, 中和物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 方向, 指导, 趋势
stems_affixes.word_buile: direct直接的;指导;指向+ion动作或状态→n.方向, 指导, 趋势

stems_affixes.value_cn: 主任, 主管, 导演
stems_affixes.word_buile: direct直接的+or人或物器→n.主任, 主管, 导演
rect正,直+angle角→[四个角]都是直角→矩形
rect正,直+itude状态→正直的状态→诚实,正直
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
rect正,直+ify……化→使……正直→改正[错误]

means.word_mean: 指导,管理
指挥,命令
方面,方向
其他释义

entry.def: A direction is the general line that someone or something is moving or pointing in.

example.ex: St Andrews was ten miles in the opposite direction...
example.tran: 圣安德鲁斯在相反方向上 10 英里处。

example.ex: He drove off in the direction of Larry's shop...
example.tran: 他驾车朝着拉里商店的方向驶去。

entry.def: A direction is the general way in which something develops or progresses.

example.ex: They threatened to walk out if the party did not change direction...
example.tran: 他们威胁说，如果该党不改变方针，他们就将集体退席。

example.ex: I've never done any sustained writing, but that might be one of my next directions.
example.tran: 我以前从未尝试过持续写作，不过那可能是我下一步努力的方向之一。

entry.def: Directions are instructions that tell you what to do, how to do something, or how to get somewhere.

example.ex: I should know by now not to throw away the directions until we've finished cooking...
example.tran: 现在我知道了不该在饭没做完之前就扔掉烹饪说明。

example.ex: He proceeded to give Dan directions to the computer room.
example.tran: 他接着告诉丹去计算机房该怎么走。

entry.def: The direction of a film, play, or television programme is the work that the director does while it is being made.
entry.tran: (影片、戏剧或电视节目的)导演

example.ex: His failures underline the difference between theatre and film direction.
example.tran: 他的失败说明了导演戏剧和电影是不同的。

means.word_mean: 1. a line leading to a place or point;
2. the spatial relation between something and the course along which it points or moves;

sentences.sentence: "he checked the direction and velocity of the wind"

means.word_mean: 3. a general course along which something has a tendency to develop;

sentences.sentence: "I couldn't follow the direction of his thoughts"
"his ideals determined the direction of his career"
"they proposed a new direction for the firm"

means.word_mean: 4. something that provides direction or advice as to a decision or course of action
5. the act of managing something;

sentences.sentence: "he was given overall management of the program"
"is the direction of the economy a function of government?"

means.word_mean: 6. a message describing how something is to be done;

sentences.sentence: "he gave directions faster than she could follow them"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of setting and holding a course;

sentences.sentence: "a new council was installed under the direction of the king"

means.word_mean: 8. a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something;
9. the concentration of attention or energy on something;

sentences.sentence: "the focus of activity shifted to molecular biology"
"he had no direction in his life"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Latin directio(n-), from the verb dirigere (see direct)
